title: 60's/70's fonts + another one
content:
hi there  
i was wondering what's the name of these couple of fonts

by the way if anyone can post some interesting suggestions  
(the more you can suggest, the better)  
on other type of 60's/70's fonts, not just the Psychedelic Filmore East  
or the Psychedelic Avalon available around, or the Butterfly, Hendrix  
thanks in advance

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [16579.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120231235/http:/typophile.com/files/16579.gif) | 5.81 KB |
| [16579-copy.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120231235/http:/typophile.com/files/16579-copy.gif) | 6.62 KB |
author: jahcoozi

comments.content:
The first one is Linotype's Davida

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=davida](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120231235/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=davida "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=davida")

and the second one resembles Mojo, but is not completely similar

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=mojo](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120231235/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=mojo "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=mojo")

Second one reminds me of the Psychedelic family from T-26 but not an exact match, could be custom.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/psychedelic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120231235/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/psychedelic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/psychedelic/")
Second one is also close to [Jonah](http://web.archive.org/web/20141120231235/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/jonah/) from Canada Type, but also not exact.
